ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, n ka cʉ́ʼʉ légɔɔn nò mbwó pi, ńgyá ngie à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ ń de gɔɔn páʼ ngwɔ́ n gɔɔn nò mbwó pʉ̀a pie é júʼu ncwò Zẅìge Ssé wɔ́. Mèŋ ka gɔɔn pɔ́ na ntí gie ngwɔ́ n gɔɔn nò mbwó pʉ̀a pie é nyé ńjúʼu pɔ́ mmó gie mbùm yɔb ne ńgɔɔn. N gɔɔn pɔ́ páʼ à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ n gɔɔn nò mbwó pʉ̀a pie ée na lezǎb ntʉ́m na Keleto, ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ púɔ mepÿɛ́.
en: For my part, brothers and sisters, I was not able to speak to you as spiritual people but as people of the flesh, as babies in Christ.

ngiemboon: N ka náa gẅí lepʉ̌. N te ná shúm léjÿó mpfɛ́ pfɛ̌ né pi wɔ́, mélàʼmie pi ka nyé te kuʼu lépfɛ́ɛ mmó. Tà mbɔɔ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, pi nyě pɔ́ te kuʼu léjúʼu nò gie á tʉʉ léjúʼ,
en: I gave you milk to drink, not solid food, since you were not yet ready for it. In fact, you are still not ready,

ngiemboon: á nue membùm mí zɔ nyé sáʼa gẅí, lekwɔʼɔ́ lóŋ zɔɔn ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ndʉʼʉ́ ndʉʼʉ́ nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Membùm mí zɔ těen ńdɔgɔ ńnyé sáʼa gẅí wɔ́? Pi těen ńdɔgɔ púʼu, ńnyé ńgÿo pɔ́ páʼ pʉ̀a njÿó gÿo wɔ́?
en: because you are still worldly. For since there is envy   and strife  # 3:3 Other mss add and divisions,# 3:3 Ti 3:9 among you, are you not worldly and behaving like mere humans?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅi neŋé tà ńgɔɔn ngie: «À gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ we Pɔ̂ɔ, wetsɔ̌ gɔɔn ngie à gwɔ́ yé pɔ́ nyìŋ we Apolɔ́sè,» mbà á téen ńdɔgɔ ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ shwóŋè pʉ̀a njÿó wɔ́ ka?
en: For whenever someone says, “I belong to Paul,” and another, “I belong to Apollos,”   are you not acting like mere humans?

ngiemboon: Apolɔ́sè aa páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wɔ́? Pɔ̂ɔ gwɔ́ wɔ̌? Tá pi gɔɔn púʼu? Peg yé gwɔ̌ pɔ́ pafaʼa fàʼ Ssé pie pi la zẅɛ́ʼɛ wég tá ńzáb ntʉ́m na Yěsô Keleto. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ na peg yé wɔ́ɔ, à gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la ná shÿó ngie à gÿo.
en: What then is Apollos? What is Paul? They are servants through whom you believed, and each has the role the Lord has given.

ngiemboon: N ka páa tÿǒ ssé, Apolɔ́sè pfɛte ntse mǒ. Tá e Ssé zɔ̌ gÿo á kẅág.
en: I planted,   Apollos watered, but God gave the growth.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, nyìŋ gẅie à páa tÿǒ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à pfɛte ntse téen ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́. E Ssé gẅie à gÿo á kẅága zɔ gẅiin nò ntsèm.
en: So, then, neither the one who plants nor the one who waters is anything, but only God who gives the growth.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à páa tÿǒ pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à pfɛte ntse mǒ, é pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ na pɔ́b wɔ́ɔ gÿo ńkẅé wé ntsɔʼɔ́fàʼ e kuʼu na fàʼ gie à fǎʼ.
en: Now he who plants and he who waters are one,   and each will receive his own reward according to his own labor.

ngiemboon: Á nue peg puté ńne faʼa pɔ́ fàʼa Ssé. Pi gwɔ́ nkáʼ Ssé, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ ndá gie Ssé ne ńkwɛ́ɛ.
en: For we are God’s coworkers.   You are God’s field, God’s building.  # 3:9 1Pt 2:5

ngiemboon: E Ssé ka cÿó gʉm yɔ́ɔn, n nuŋe cÿóndá páʼ ngàŋlevfò wembòŋo. N ka nuŋe cÿóndá, wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ ne ńdɔgɔ fàʼ ńgee mvfò. Á ne ńkwɛ́ɛ ndá ndumó. Táʼ, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ laga twó yé na ntí gie à lɔgɔ ńkwɛ́ɛ ndá ndumó.
en: According to God’s grace that was given to me, I have laid a foundation as a skilled master builder,   and another builds on it. But each one is to be careful how he builds on it.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na cÿóndá, mbà á kéen ńdáʼ ńgwɔ́ ssé, ńgwɔ́ Yěsô Keleto. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ngwɔ́ á le gíŋ ńnuŋe tsɔ́ yendyɛ̀ʼɛ wɔ́.
en: For no one can lay any foundation   other than what has been laid down. That foundation is Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ nyìŋ cʉ́ʼʉ lépwóon ndá na cÿó ŋwɛ́ ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ḿbwóon. Wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nkáb ḿbwóon. Wetsɔ̌ lɔgɔ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ metǒon ḿbwóon. Wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ lɔg yé pɔ́ metÿǒ ńkwɛ́. Wetsɔ̌ lɔgɔ legǐ njǔm kà pǐŋ wɔ́ɔ ḿbáʼ.
en: If anyone builds on the foundation with gold, silver,   costly stones,  # 3:12 Rv 17:4 wood, hay, or straw,

ngiemboon: Mbà e te tsɔ̌ ntsaŋ wɔ́. Afàʼ ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ge láʼ kẅɛɛ mángyɛ̌. Mé ge láʼ gyá á na lyɛ̌ʼ gie mé tsɔ́ʼte mentsaŋ. Á nue mmɔ̌g ge láʼ cʉa na fàʼ ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tá mé gyá páʼ áa jʉʼó ńgwɔ́ púʼu.
en: each one’s work will become obvious. For the day will disclose it, because it will be revealed by fire;   the fire will test the quality of each one’s work.  # 3:13 Ps 62:12; Pr 24:12; Mt 16:27; 2Co 5:10; 1Pt 1:17

ngiemboon: Ammó gie nyìŋ la lɔg ńkwɛ́ ndá na cÿóndá ŋwɛ́, lɔɔn ńdáʼ te shÿó, mbà ngàŋ ge láʼ kẅé péen.
en: If anyone’s work that he has built survives, he will receive a reward.

ngiemboon: Tá fàʼ ye nyìŋ lɔɔn ńké ńdáʼ shÿó, mbà ngàŋ ge láʼ táŋa pyé, é ké tsẅɛ́ tsẅɛ́ táʼ, é tsẅɛ́ páʼ nyìŋ gẅie à tɔgɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lʉ́me mmɔ̌g tá ńtsẅɛ́ la.
en: If anyone’s work is burned up, he will experience   loss, but he himself will be saved  # 3:15 Mt 9:22; Ac 16:30; Eph 2:8  #— #but only as through fire.  # 3:15 Jd 23

ngiemboon: Pi te ne ńzsé ngie pi ee pɛ́ʼɛ̀ ńgwɔ́ jʉʼʉ ssé, à Zẅìge Ssé tsẅé tsoló wɔ́ ka?
en: Don’t you yourselves know that you are God’s temple   and that the Spirit of God lives in you?  # 3:16 Lv 26:11; Jms 4:5

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńtágte jʉʼʉ Ssé, mbà Ssé ge gÿo tágte ngàŋ é gwáʼ. Á nue ajʉʼʉ Ssé, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ yé gíle yé. Pi piŋ ńgẅiin lézsé ngie jʉʼʉ Ssé ŋwɛ́ á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ gẅí wɛ̂.
en: If anyone destroys God’s temple, God will destroy him;   for God’s temple is holy,  # 3:17 Ps 20:6; 1Co 7:14 and that is what you are.

ngiemboon: Ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ léfʉte twó mbùm yé. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ńne ńkwaŋa ngie pʉ̀a njÿó ne ńgyá ngie aa nzsènò, á zɔɔn ḿvɔg sele ńcʉ́ʼʉ pʉ̀a, tá ńdeen ńké ńgwɔ́ kwàʼ nzsènò.
en: Let no one deceive   himself. If anyone among you thinks he is wise in this age,  # 3:18 Lk 16:8 let him become a fool  # 3:18 Mt 5:22 so that he can become wise.  # 3:18 Is 5:21; Jr 8:8–9; Gl 6:3

ngiemboon: Á nue anò gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó ńgwɔ́ zsénò, áa mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ menò pʉ̀a. Aŋwàʼne Ssé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: «E Ssé lɔg pɔ́ lejÿɔʼ nzsènò ńdɔg ńgwoon yé.»
en: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness   with God, since it is written,  # 3:19 Ac 15:15; Gl 4:22 He catches the wise in their craftiness;  # 3:19 Jb 5:13,# 3:19 Jb 5:13; Lk 20:23

ngiemboon: Aŋwàʼne Ssé gíŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zsé nkwaŋá nò pazsé nò. À zsě ngie é té tsɔ́ mmó kuʼ.»
en: and again, The Lord knows that the reasonings    of the wise are futile.   # 3:20 Ps 94:11,# 3:20 Ps 94:11

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, tà nyìŋ gẅi lɔg páʼ aa nyìŋ we mákìkyè ńdɔg ńkaʼte. Á nue akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ, gwɔ́ pɔ́ gí.
en: So let no one boast in human leaders, for everything is yours    #— #

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Pɔ̂ɔ, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Apolɔ́sè, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Sefásè, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ njÿó, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ legwɔ́ wó kà pɔ́ lékwé wɔ́ɔ, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ yɔɔn kème njÿó kà gie á nyé tá ńne ńtóo wɔ́ɔ, mbà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbwó pi.
en: whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas   or the world or life  # 3:22 1Jn 5:12 or death  # 3:22 Mt 10:21; Jn 8:51; Php 3:10 or things present or things to come  # 3:22 Rm 8:38  #— #everything is yours,

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa na pi, pi gwɔ́ mbwó Keleto, Keleto piŋ ńgwɔ́ mbwó Ssé.
en: and you belong to Christ,   and Christ belongs to God.
